title: Textile, ca. 1850
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
description: Cream colored cotton, printed in black. Scenes from Don Quixote. Elaborate enframents in rococo style for various episodes. On grouped emblems inscriptions: Amadis de Gaula, Ami Dulcinea". On another: "Post Tenebras Spero Lucem, Galatea, Buscapia, etc." Both selvages present. Each scene about 0M260 high (10 1/2").

tombstone.epitaph:
